metadata.title: CVE-2020-25212 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A TOCTOU mismatch in the NFS client code in the Linux kernel before 5.8.3could be used by local attackers to corrupt memory or possibly haveunspecified other impact because a size check is in fs/nfs/nfs4proc.cinstead of fs/nfs/nfs4xdr.c, aka CID-b4487b935452.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-120-generic - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-120-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-120-lowlatency - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-120-generic - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-120-lowlatency - 4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1080-kvm - 4.4.0-1080.87
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-aws - 4.4.0-1114.127
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1085-aws - 4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-azure - 4.15.0-1098.109~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1086-gcp - 4.15.0-1086.98~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-oracle - 4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1139.148
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1080.87').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.127').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1086.98~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.148').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.152').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
